intro: Pimpinella dichotoma var. vegeta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, fern-like appearance. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early spring.
